lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Stephen Hanke, chief economist at Friedburg Commodity Management, said OPEC production was lower "because of the Saudi cut (to 3.1 mln bpd) and this could spell trouble if it gives other members an incentive to exceed their quotas."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "OPEC is keeping its production down, and in the cash market there is tight supply of crude with short transportation time to major refining centers," said Daniel McKinley, oil analyst with Smith Barney, Harris Upham and Co. "

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Oil traders were pulling prices down on the assumption that oil stocks were building and OPEC was producing well above its 15.8 mln bpd quota, but now both of those assumptions have come under question," McKinley said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Stephen Hanke, chief economist at Friedburg Commodity Management, said OPEC production was lower "because of the Saudi cut (to 3.1 mln bpd) and this could spell trouble if it gives other members an incentive to exceed their quotas."
